medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented at 6 weeks of age with hyperglycemia (626 mg/dl). He was born after 41 weeks of uneventful pregnancy and experienced an uneventful neonatal period. His insulin requirements gradually decreased after treatment and were stopped by 12 months of age. Currently, at 1 year and 9 months, he maintains normal HbA1c without treatment.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's father developed diabetes at 22 years of age; the paternal grandfather was diagnosed at 3 years of age and was managed with insulin until 21 years old. The paternal aunt was diagnosed with gestational diabetes at 26 years of age.
